column4: Panasonic cuts profit view on upfront investment in Tesla battery plant
column5: TOKYO Japan's Panasonic Corp  on Monday said it has cut its annual profit forecast after bringing forward some of its investment in a battery plant for U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla Motors Inc  in anticipation of strong EV demand.

column4: UPDATE 2-Panasonic cuts profit view on upfront investment in Tesla battery plant
column5: * CEO says more investment in batteries to come on solid EV demand

column4: BRIEF-Panasonic sees shortage in battery production capacity if Tesla sales go smoothly
column5: * Expects a shortage in battery production capacity if Tesla Motors Inc sales go smoothly  Further company coverage:    (Reporting by Makiko Yamazaki)
